general_info.description: German Shepherds are intelligent, loyal, and protective dogs, originally bred in Germany as herding and working dogs.

physical_characteristics.head: Wedge-shaped head with strong muzzle
physical_characteristics.fur: Double coat with dense undercoat and coarse outer coat
physical_characteristics.tail: Long, bushy tail that hangs down when relaxed

history: Developed in Germany in the late 19th century for herding and protection tasks.

care.exercise: Requires regular exercise to maintain physical and mental health.
care.grooming: Sheds heavily; regular brushing is necessary.
care.training: Highly trainable; early socialization and obedience training are recommended.

preventiveTips: Feed smaller, more frequent meals instead of one big meal.
Avoid vigorous exercise immediately before or after meals.
Consult with a veterinarian about preventive measures like gastropexy.

owner_tips: Provide daily exercise to prevent boredom and destructive behavior.
Engage in mental stimulation activities to satisfy their working instincts.
Socialize early to ensure they are well-rounded and comfortable around strangers.

general_info.description: Labrador Retrievers are friendly, outgoing, and high-spirited dogs.

physical_characteristics.head: Broad head with a strong, square muzzle
physical_characteristics.tail: Thick, tapering tail known as an 'otter' tail

history: Originated in Newfoundland, Canada, as a fishing and retrieving companion.

care.exercise: Requires regular exercise to maintain health and happiness.
care.grooming: Minimal grooming needed; occasional brushing recommended.
care.training: Eager to please and highly trainable; responds well to positive reinforcement.

preventiveTips: Maintain a healthy diet and regular exercise routine.
Regular veterinary check-ups to monitor weight and joint health.
Provide mental stimulation to prevent boredom-related behaviors.

owner_tips: Ensure daily physical and mental exercise to keep them happy.
Socialize early to promote well-rounded behavior.
Provide a balanced diet to maintain optimal health.

general_info.description: Golden Retrievers are friendly, tolerant, and intelligent dogs.

physical_characteristics.head: Broad head with a gentle expression
physical_characteristics.fur: Water-repellant double coat with a dense undercoat
physical_characteristics.tail: Long, feathered tail that is often carried with a slight upward curve

history: Developed in Scotland in the mid-19th century for retrieving games during hunting.

care.exercise: Requires regular exercise to maintain health and happiness.
care.grooming: Regular brushing needed to manage shedding.
care.training: Highly trainable and eager to please; responds well to positive reinforcement.

preventiveTips: Maintain a healthy diet and regular exercise routine.
Regular veterinary check-ups to monitor health.
Provide mental stimulation to prevent boredom-related behaviors.

owner_tips: Ensure daily physical and mental exercise to keep them happy.
Socialize early to promote well-rounded behavior.
Provide a balanced diet to maintain optimal health.

general_info.description: Beagles are curious, merry, and friendly dogs.

physical_characteristics.head: Rounded head with a black nose
physical_characteristics.fur: Short, dense coat, commonly tri-colored (black, tan, and white)
physical_characteristics.body: Compact, muscular frame with a straight back
physical_characteristics.tail: Medium-length tail with a slight curve, carried high

history: Beagles originated in England as scent hounds for hunting small game like rabbits.
They were developed for their strong sense of smell and ability to work in packs.

care.exercise: Beagles are active and require daily exercise to keep them fit and prevent boredom.
care.grooming: Regular brushing is sufficient, but they may shed seasonally.
care.training: Beagles can be a bit stubborn but are generally food-driven, making them trainable with patience.

preventiveTips: Maintain a healthy weight through portion control and regular exercise.
Clean ears regularly to avoid infections.
Provide mental stimulation to prevent boredom-related behaviors.

owner_tips: Beagles are known for their strong sense of smell, so keep them in a secured area to avoid escape.
They enjoy companionship, so consider adopting another dog if possible.
They need regular training and socialization to ensure they remain well-behaved.

general_info.description: Bulldogs are calm, courageous, and loyal dogs with a distinctive wrinkled face.

physical_characteristics.head: Large, wrinkled face with a pushed-in nose
physical_characteristics.body: Compact, muscular body with a broad chest

history: Originated in England, bred for bull-baiting and later as companion dogs.

care.exercise: Require moderate exercise due to their calm nature.
care.training: Can be a bit stubborn, but responsive to positive reinforcement.

preventiveTips: Regular vet check-ups to monitor respiratory health.
Provide a balanced diet to maintain weight.
Keep their skin folds clean and dry to prevent infections.

owner_tips: Bulldogs are ideal for apartment living due to their calm demeanor.
They require minimal exercise but should still have regular walks.
Be mindful of their breathing, especially in hot weather.

general_info.description: Poodles are highly intelligent, active, and proud dogs, known for their curly coats.

physical_characteristics.ears: Long, elegant, with a slight wave
physical_characteristics.head: Rounded head with a refined expression
physical_characteristics.fur: Curly, dense coat that requires regular grooming

history: Poodles originated in Germany as water retrievers and were later refined in France.

care.exercise: Poodles are active and need regular exercise to stay fit and healthy.
care.grooming: Requires frequent grooming to prevent matting of the curly coat.
care.training: Highly trainable due to their intelligence and eagerness to please.

preventiveTips: Regular vet check-ups for monitoring joint and eye health.
Balanced diet to prevent obesity.
Regular grooming to maintain healthy skin and coat.

owner_tips: Poodles need mental and physical stimulation to stay happy.
Early socialization is key to prevent any timid behavior.
Consider professional grooming for maintaining their curly coat.

general_info.description: Rottweilers are confident, courageous, and loyal dogs, known for their strength and protective instincts.

physical_characteristics.head: Broad, muscular head with strong jaws
physical_characteristics.fur: Short, dense coat that is easy to maintain
physical_characteristics.tail: Short to medium tail that is often docked

history: Rottweilers originated in Germany and were used as herding and guard dogs.

care.exercise: Requires regular exercise to maintain physical fitness and prevent boredom.
care.grooming: Minimal grooming required; occasional brushing is sufficient.
care.training: Trainable but needs firm, consistent training due to their strong-willed nature.

preventiveTips: Regular veterinary check-ups to monitor for heart and joint issues.
Proper diet and exercise to maintain a healthy weight.
Avoid excessive jumping to prevent joint stress.

owner_tips: Rottweilers are excellent family pets when properly trained and socialized.
Be firm and consistent in training to avoid dominance issues.
Ensure they receive enough exercise to avoid behavioral problems.

general_info.description: Boxers are playful, energetic, and strong dogs with a great love for family.

physical_characteristics.head: Square-shaped head with a broad jaw

history: Boxers were originally bred in Germany for hunting and as guard dogs.

care.exercise: Boxers need regular exercise to burn off their high energy levels.
care.grooming: Minimal grooming required; occasional brushing is sufficient.
care.training: Boxers are intelligent but need firm, consistent training to control their high energy.

preventiveTips: Maintain a healthy weight through portion control and exercise.
Regular vet check-ups for heart and joint monitoring.
Avoid overexertion in hot weather.

owner_tips: Boxers need a lot of playtime and mental stimulation.
They are very social dogs and should not be left alone for long periods.
Make sure they get enough exercise to avoid destructive behavior.

general_info.description: Dachshunds are energetic and intelligent dogs, originally bred to hunt small game.

physical_characteristics.head: Long, narrow head with an alert expression
physical_characteristics.fur: Short to long coat depending on the variety

history: Dachshunds were bred in Germany to hunt small game like rabbits and badgers.

care.exercise: Dachshunds are energetic and enjoy walks and playtime.
care.grooming: Coat grooming depends on the variety; long-haired Dachshunds need more frequent brushing.
care.training: Dachshunds are independent and can be stubborn, but they respond well to positive reinforcement.

preventiveTips: Monitor their weight to avoid obesity and back issues.
Provide joint supplements if recommended by a vet.
Regular vet visits to monitor overall health.

owner_tips: Dachshunds enjoy a lot of interaction and playtime.
Due to their small size, they adapt well to apartment living.
Avoid excessive jumping to protect their spine from injury.
